arm_group.description: Ovulation trigger with Ovitrelle 250 microgram, luteal support with vaginal progesterone: gel Crinone 8% daily.
ovulation trigger with Decapeptyl 0.2 mg, luteal support with 2 injections of 1,500 U hCG.

brief_summary.textblock:
Ovulation trigger is needed in IVF to get mature eggs. Routinely, hCG is used for that
      purpose given its similarity to the natural hormone that does this job in a natural cycle
      (luteinizing hormone, LH). In a natural cycle another hormone takes part in the process
      (FSH). To induce a natural-like ovulation surge that includes LH and FSH , GnRH agonist can
      be given.

      The purpose of this study is to find out which approach may work better in IVF patients who
      experienced 4 IVF failures.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ovulation Trigger With hCG Compared to GnRH Agonist in Patients With Repeated IVF Failures

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  IVF patients with at least 4 consecutive failures.

          -  On trigger day, no more than 10 follicles of 12 mm and up

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  History of moderate or severe OHSS.

intervention.other_name: Oovulation trigger with Decapeptyl 0.2 mg, luteal support with 2 injections of 1,500 U hCG.

other_name: Luteal support with daily progesterone gel = Crinone 8%

primary_outcome.measure: Fetal heart activity 1 month after oocyte retrieval

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patients comfort during the luteal phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During 2 weeks from day of oocyte retrieval

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
